required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Rapid Prototyping Models for Patient Education
clinical_study.official_title: Use of 3-D Printed Models to Improve Patient Understanding During the Informed Consent Process: A Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: Pre-made rapid prototyping models will be used to increase patient education versus current methodologies.

detailed_description.textblock: Post-partum women and their co-parent will have a medical condition explained to them first verbally, followed by a questionnaire, and then with the use of anatomical models created by rapid prototyping, followed by a questionnaire. The two questionnaires will then be compared.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year
through study completion, an average of 1 year

arm_group.description: Post-partum women following an atraumatic pregnancy.
Co-parents to post-partum women following an atraumatic pregnancy.

intervention.description: Rapid prototyping models of anatomy will be used to demonstrate an anatomic and medical condition and participants will grade the experience on a questionnaire.

study_pop.textblock: Post-partum women and respective co-parents who are greater than 18 years of age and fluent in the English language.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mother
- Post-partum
- Atraumatic delivery of healthy, live infant at HMC
- Age > 18
Co-parent
- Co-parent
- Atraumatic delivery of healthy, live infant at HMC
- Age > 18
Exclusion Criteria:
- any pregnancy related issues
- fetal loss
- NICU stay > 6 hours
- Emergent cesarean section
- Post-partum hemorrhage
- Hysterectomy
- Any other condition requiring unplanned, medical intervention during labor and delivery
- Prior fetal loss or anomaly
- Inability to read or write English
- those who do not consent
